communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

According to local news reports, Detectives with the Fayetteville Police Department’s Cold Case Sexual Assault Unit made an arrest in September in connection with a 1997 sexual assault cold case. According to the report, using DNA technology not available in 1997 and collaborated with Parabon Nanolabs, Inc., the NC State Crime Laboratory, analysts with the FBI’s Violent Criminal Apprehension Program, and other members of Fayetteville Police Department’s Sexual Assault Cold Case Multidisciplinary Team. I am looking for:

-  Investigative reports, memos,  incident reports regarding this case
-  Any invoices, contracts, or MOUs, with Parabon Nanolabs
-  Any emails to or from representatives at Parabon nano labs.  "*@parabon.com"
-  internal Memos, communications, or presentations referencing "Parabon"
-  communications with the state crime laboratory referencing "parabon" or "snapshot"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following record:


1) I request any and all records regarding Sober Homes available for use by the Barnstable County Sheriff Correctional Facility to include, the addresses, contact information for any and all Sober Homes, Detox Programs, half houses or partial hospitalization programs, and /or any after care programs available, referred by or on behalf of anyone from the Barnstable County Sheriff Correctional facility from 2016 to present to include in state and out of state referrals and contact information.  
2) The employment contract and total compensation, benefits and any "other payments"  to Attorney Amy Kullar, In House Counsel BCSO, Richard COREY Jr, from 2022-2023 and documents naming from which accounts these funds were paid and all approval paperwork for payments.
3) I request the internal and/or public posting for the newly created Barnstable County Sheriff office,  Administrative Deputy Superintendent (ADS) Training position to include any and all qualifications, job descriptions, responsibilities for the ADS of Training.
4) Any email sent from or to Donald Doyles official Barnstable sheriff email to all of the following : "Svetlana Marichal", "Ryan Woods," "Riley Doyle", "Michael Clancy", "Isabel Clancy",  to or from any party with an email address including the "@fgrecoverycenters.com".
5) An email sent by ADS Kevin Fernandes, via his BSCO employee email on 10/4/2023 at 0103 hrs.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daralyn Heywood

communications.communication:

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYC Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of lawsuits that details police misconduct brought against the city's police officers and/or the department by civilians or protesters who were injured during the 2020 George Floyd Protests from May 2020 to December 2021.

Copies of settlements that details the amount that plaintiffs who were injured by police during the 2020 George Floyd Protests received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brianna Knibbs

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Nashville Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of lawsuits that details police misconduct brought against the city's police officers and/or the department by civilians or protesters who were injured during the 2020 George Floyd Protests from May 2020 to December 2021.

Copies of settlements that details the amount that plaintiffs who were injured by police during the 2020 George Floyd Protests received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Brianna Knibbs.
